verses.verse: For this <S%G3778><s%> Melchizedek, <S%G3198><s%> king <S%G935><s%> of Salem, <S%G4532><s%> priest <S%G2409><s%> of the Most <S%G5310><s%> High <S%G5310><s%> God, <S%G2316><s%> who met <S%G4876><s%> Abraham <S%G11><s%> as he was returning <S%G5290><s%> from the slaughter <S%G2871><s%> of the kings <S%G935><s%> and blessed <S%G2127><s%> him,

to whom <S%G3739><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> Abraham <S%G11><s%> apportioned <S%G3307><s%> a tenth <S%G1181><s%> part <S%G1181><s%> of all <S%G3956><s%> [the spoils], was first <S%G4413><s%> of all, <S%G4413><s%> by the translation <S%G2059><s%> [of his name], king <S%G935><s%> of righteousness, <S%G1343><s%> and then <S%G1899><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> king <S%G935><s%> of Salem, <S%G4532><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> is king <S%G935><s%> of peace. <S%G1515><s%>

Without <S%G540><s%> father, <S%G540><s%> without <S%G282><s%> mother, <S%G282><s%> without <S%G35><s%> genealogy, <S%G35><s%> having <S%G2192><s%> neither <S%G3383><s%> beginning <S%G746><s%> of days <S%G2250><s%> nor <S%G3383><s%> end <S%G5056><s%> of life, <S%G2222><s%> but made <S%G871><s%> like <S%G871><s%> the Son <S%G5207><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> he abides <S%G3306><s%> a priest <S%G2409><s%> perpetually. <S%G1519><s%> <S%G1336><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> observe <S%G2334><s%> how <S%G4080><s%> great <S%G4080><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> man <S%G3778><s%> was to whom <S%G3739><s%> Abraham, <S%G11><s%> the patriarch, <S%G3966><s%> gave <S%G1325><s%> a tenth <S%G1181><s%> of the choicest <S%G205><s%> spoils. <S%G205><s%>

And those <S%G3588><s%> indeed <S%G3303><s%> of the sons <S%G5207><s%> of Levi <S%G3017><s%> who receive <S%G2983><s%> the priest's office <S%G2405><s%> have <S%G2192><s%> commandment <S%G1785><s%> in the Law <S%G3551><s%> to collect <S%G586><s%> a tenth <S%G586><s%> from the people, <S%G2992><s%> that is, from their brethren, <S%G80><s%> although <S%G2539><s%> these are descended <S%G1831><s%> <S%G3751><s%> from Abraham. <S%G11><s%>

But the one whose genealogy <S%G1075><s%> is not traced <S%G1075><s%> from them collected <S%G1183><s%> a tenth <S%G1183><s%> from Abraham, <S%G11><s%> and blessed <S%G2127><s%> the one who had <S%G2192><s%> the promises. <S%G1860><s%>
But without <S%G5565><s%> any <S%G3956><s%> dispute <S%G485><s%> the lesser <S%G1640><s%> is blessed <S%G2127><s%> by the greater. <S%G2909><s%>

And in this <S%G5602><s%> case <S%G5602><s%> mortal <S%G599><s%> men <S%G444><s%> receive <S%G2983><s%> tithes, <S%G1181><s%> but in that case <S%G1563><s%> one [receives them], of whom it is witnessed <S%G3140><s%> that he lives <S%G2198><s%> on.

And, so <S%G5613><s%> <S%G2031><s%> to speak, <S%G3004><s%> through <S%G1223><s%> Abraham <S%G11><s%> even <S%G2532><s%> Levi, <S%G3017><s%> who received <S%G2983><s%> tithes, <S%G1181><s%> paid <S%G1183><s%> tithes, <S%G1183><s%>
for he was still <S%G2089><s%> in the loins <S%G3751><s%> of his father <S%G3962><s%> when <S%G3753><s%> Melchizedek <S%G3198><s%> met <S%G4876><s%> him.

Now <S%G3767><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> perfection <S%G5050><s%> was through <S%G1223><s%> the Levitical <S%G3020><s%> priesthood <S%G2420><s%> (for on the basis <S%G1909><s%> of it the people <S%G2992><s%> received <S%G3549><s%> the Law <S%G3549><s%>), what <S%G5101><s%> further <S%G2089><s%> need <S%G5532><s%> [was there] for another <S%G2087><s%> priest <S%G2409><s%> to arise <S%G450><s%> according <S%G2596><s%> to the order <S%G5010><s%> of Melchizedek, <S%G3198><s%> and not be designated <S%G3004><s%> according <S%G2596><s%> to the order <S%G5010><s%> of Aaron?
For when the priesthood <S%G2420><s%> is changed, <S%G3346><s%> of necessity <S%G318><s%> there takes <S%G1096><s%> place <S%G1096><s%> a change <S%G3331><s%> of law <S%G3551><s%> also. <S%G2532><s%>

For the one concerning <S%G1909><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> things <S%G3778><s%> are spoken <S%G3004><s%> belongs <S%G3348><s%> to another <S%G2087><s%> tribe, <S%G5443><s%> from which <S%G3739><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> one <S%G3762><s%> has officiated <S%G4337><s%> at the altar. <S%G2379><s%>

For it is evident <S%G4271><s%> that our Lord <S%G2962><s%> was descended <S%G393><s%> from Judah, <S%G2455><s%> a tribe <S%G5443><s%> with reference <S%G1519><s%> to which <S%G3739><s%> Moses <S%G3475><s%> spoke <S%G2980><s%> nothing <S%G3762><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> priests. <S%G2409><s%>

And this is clearer <S%G2612><s%> still, <S%G2089><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> another <S%G2087><s%> priest <S%G2409><s%> arises <S%G450><s%> according <S%G2596><s%> to the likeness <S%G3665><s%> of Melchizedek, <S%G3198><s%>

who <S%G3739><s%> has become <S%G1096><s%> [such] not on the basis <S%G2596><s%> of a law <S%G3551><s%> of physical <S%G4560><s%> requirement, <S%G1785><s%> but according <S%G2596><s%> to the power <S%G1411><s%> of an indestructible <S%G179><s%> life. <S%G2222><s%>
For it is witnessed <S%G3140><s%> [of Him], "Thou art a priest <S%G2409><s%> forever <S%G165><s%> According <S%G2596><s%> to the order <S%G5010><s%> of Melchizedek. <S%G3198><s%>"

For, on the one <S%G3303><s%> hand, <S%G3303><s%> there is a setting <S%G115><s%> aside <S%G115><s%> of a former <S%G4254><s%> commandment <S%G1785><s%> because <S%G1223><s%> of its weakness <S%G772><s%> and uselessness <S%G512><s%>

(for the Law <S%G3551><s%> made <S%G5048><s%> nothing <S%G3762><s%> perfect <S%G5048><s%>), and on the other <S%G1161><s%> hand <S%G1161><s%> there is a bringing <S%G1898><s%> in of a better <S%G2909><s%> hope, <S%G1680><s%> through <S%G1223><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> we draw <S%G1448><s%> near <S%G1448><s%> to God. <S%G2316><s%>
And inasmuch <S%G2596><s%> <S%G3745><s%> as [it was] not without <S%G5565><s%> an oath <S%G3728><s%>

(for they indeed <S%G3303><s%> became <S%G1096><s%> priests <S%G2409><s%> without <S%G5565><s%> an oath, <S%G3728><s%> but He with an oath <S%G3728><s%> through <S%G1223><s%> the One who said <S%G3004><s%> to Him, "The Lord <S%G2962><s%> has sworn <S%G3660><s%> And will not change <S%G3338><s%> His mind, <S%G3338><s%> 'Thou art a priest <S%G2409><s%> forever <S%G165><s%>'");

so <S%G5118><s%> much <S%G5118><s%> the more <S%G2596><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> has become <S%G1096><s%> the guarantee <S%G1450><s%> of a better <S%G2909><s%> covenant. <S%G1242><s%>

And the [former] priests, <S%G2409><s%> on the one <S%G3303><s%> hand, <S%G3303><s%> existed <S%G1510><s%> <S%G1096><s%> in greater <S%G4183><s%> numbers, <S%G4183><s%> because <S%G1223><s%> they were prevented <S%G2967><s%> by death <S%G2288><s%> from continuing, <S%G3887><s%>
but He, on the other <S%G1161><s%> hand, <S%G1161><s%> because <S%G1223><s%> He abides <S%G3306><s%> forever, <S%G165><s%> holds <S%G2192><s%> His priesthood <S%G2420><s%> permanently. <S%G531><s%>

Hence, <S%G3606><s%> also, <S%G2532><s%> He is able <S%G1410><s%> to save <S%G4982><s%> forever <S%G1519><s%> <S%G3838><s%> those <S%G3588><s%> who draw <S%G4334><s%> near <S%G4334><s%> to God <S%G2316><s%> through <S%G1223><s%> Him, since He always <S%G3842><s%> lives <S%G2198><s%> to make <S%G1793><s%> intercession <S%G1793><s%> for them.

For it was fitting <S%G4241><s%> that we should have such <S%G5108><s%> a high <S%G749><s%> priest, <S%G749><s%> holy, <S%G3741><s%> innocent, <S%G172><s%> undefiled, <S%G283><s%> separated <S%G5563><s%> from sinners <S%G268><s%> and exalted <S%G5308><s%> above the heavens; <S%G3772><s%>

who <S%G3739><s%> does not need <S%G318><s%> daily, <S%G2596><s%> <S%G2250><s%> like <S%G5618><s%> those <S%G3588><s%> high <S%G749><s%> priests, <S%G749><s%> to offer <S%G399><s%> up sacrifices, <S%G2378><s%> first <S%G4387><s%> for His own <S%G2398><s%> sins, <S%G266><s%> and then <S%G1899><s%> for the [sins] of the people, <S%G2992><s%> because <S%G1063><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> He did <S%G4160><s%> once <S%G2178><s%> for all <S%G2178><s%> when He offered <S%G399><s%> up Himself. <S%G1438><s%>

For the Law <S%G3551><s%> appoints <S%G2525><s%> men <S%G444><s%> as high <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> who are weak, <S%G769><s%> but the word <S%G3056><s%> of the oath, <S%G3728><s%> which came after <S%G3326><s%> the Law, <S%G3551><s%> [appoints] a Son, <S%G5207><s%> made <S%G5048><s%> perfect <S%G5048><s%> forever. <S%G165><s%>
